Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text (much rubbed and effaced): part of 7 ll. on recto. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "year 8 of Ptol. Euergetes I (?) = BC. 240/39". See correct dating in C. Andrews publication: year 8 of Ptolemy V Epiphanes.
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegisots.org - DAHT. Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 25.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.72-3, pl.60)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48641) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48641)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss Black ink (faint) Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: leather (deteriorated) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
